content:
Inside the beautiful Tennessee Theatre the voices of students from 

campus organizations blended in splendid performances at All Campus Events

All Sing on Friday and Saturday nights PERIOD

Taking best overall performance for the second consecutive year Phi Mu

Alpha humbled their competition with their simple farm boy attire and

musical skill PERIOD

The music fraternity members swiftly flew through the challenging lyrics of

 and kept the audience laughing with their engaging

sound effects and harmony in   and 

 said Daniel Humber of Phi Mu Alpha PERIOD 

The lively 50s music of Alpha Omicron Pi and Alpha Kappa Alpha placed them

second overall PERIOD Their highenergy performance was enhanced by their

enthusiasm their colorful letter jackets and their choreography which

included a challenging type of hand jive PERIOD



AOPi president Jamie Ballinger said PERIOD 

Delta Delta Delta and Alpha Tau Omega presented 

Their stirring performance of Phantom of the Opera garnered them

third place overall and the best male and female soloist awards PERIOD

Dressed in elegant red dresses and black tuxedos these All Sing

participants commanded the stage and earned audience attention with the

powerful voices of opera soloists Bradford Bricken and Susannah

Biller PERIOD

Lambda Chi Alphas vocal sound effects throughout their Western theme made

   and the Lone Ranger theme song

some of the favorite songs of the night and won them second place in the

small single division PERIOD Their talented soloists had definite crowd

appeal PERIOD

 said

Ryan Anderson Lambda Chi Alpha soloist PERIOD 

The timeless story of the Wizard of Oz was portrayed by Beta Theta Pi and

Pi Beta Phi firstplace winners of the small mixed division PERIOD The costumes

and vocal performances of Dorothy the Tin Man the Scarecrow and the Lion

elicited smiles from the crowd PERIOD

The Baptist Student Union placed second in the small mixed division with

the theme  based on Matthew  PERIOD Their voices

especially those of the soloists were full of spirit and passion as they

engaged the audience with their songs about Jesus PERIOD

 BSU soloist Melissa Ingle said PERIOD



All Sing winners received trophies and points toward the All Campus Events

Cup which is presented to the organization with the highest total points

from Dance Marathon Carnicus Volunteer Challenge Homecoming and All

Sing PERIOD

Other awardwinning performances included Sigma Nus presentation of the

Beach Boys hits Alpha Delta Pi and Pi Kappa Phis Paul Simon theme Phi

Mus performance of Rent Sigma Kappa and Alpha Gamma Rhos version

of West Side Story and Delta Gammas presentation of songs from the

Disney musical Newsies PERIOD

Rounding out the evening was Zeta Tau Alpha presenting the songs of Dolly

Parton and Alpha Chi Omega who performed their version of the musical

Annie PERIOD

 said All Sing judge John

Hensley Jr PERIOD
